author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 1
12. Anāpattivagga
“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anāpattiṃ āpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanaahitāya paṭipannā bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as an offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apuññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ antaradhāpentī”ti.
segments.en: They make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.
“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āpattiṃ anāpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanaahitāya paṭipannā bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain an offense as non-offense are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apuññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ antaradhāpentī”ti.
segments.en: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū lahukaṃ āpattiṃ garukā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … garukaṃ āpattiṃ lahukā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ aduṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … aduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ duṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … sāvasesaṃ āpattiṃ anavasesā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … anavasesaṃ āpattiṃ sāvasesā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … sappaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ appaṭikammā āpattīti dīpenti … pe … appaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ sappaṭikammā āpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanaahitāya paṭipannā bahujanaasukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as a serious offense … a serious offense as a light offense … an offense committed with corrupt intention as an offense not committed with corrupt intention … an offense not committed with corrupt intention as an offense committed with corrupt intention … an offense requiring rehabilitation as an offense not requiring rehabilitation … an offense not requiring rehabilitation as an offense requiring rehabilitation … an offense with redress as an offense without redress … an offense without redress as an offense with redress are acting for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apuññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ antaradhāpentī”ti.
segments.en: Those mendicants make much bad karma and make the true teaching disappear.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anāpattiṃ anāpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as non-offense are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ ṭhapentī”ti.
segments.en: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”

segments.pli: Ekādasamaṃ.
“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āpattiṃ āpattīti dīpenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain an offense as an offense are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ ṭhapentī”ti.
segments.en: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”

segments.pli: Dvādasamaṃ.

“Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū lahukaṃ āpattiṃ lahukā āpattīti dīpenti … garukaṃ āpattiṃ garukā āpattīti dīpenti … duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ duṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … aduṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ aduṭṭhullā āpattīti dīpenti … sāvasesaṃ āpattiṃ sāvasesā āpattīti dīpenti … anavasesaṃ āpattiṃ anavasesā āpattīti dīpenti … sappaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ sappaṭikammā āpattīti dīpenti … appaṭikammaṃ āpattiṃ appaṭikammā āpattīti dīpenti;
segments.en: “Those mendicants who explain a light offense as a light offense … a serious offense as a serious offense … an offense committed with corrupt intention as an offense committed with corrupt intention … an offense not committed with corrupt intention as an offense not committed with corrupt intention … an offense requiring rehabilitation as an offense requiring rehabilitation … an offense not requiring rehabilitation as an offense not requiring rehabilitation … an offense with redress as an offense with redress … an offense without redress as an offense without redress

segments.pli: te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: are acting for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of the people, of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṃ pasavanti, te cimaṃ saddhammaṃ ṭhapentī”ti.
segments.en: They make much merit and make the true teaching continue.”

segments.pli: Vīsatimaṃ.
Anāpattivaggo dvādasamo.

sections.title: “Mendicants, those mendicants who explain non-offense as an offense…
